subSections.title: Etymology 1
subSections.text:
{{wikipedia|lang=ja|ナシ}} {{wikipedia|Pyrus pyrifolia}} [[File:Pear-tree,katori-city,japan.JPG|thumb|250px|{{lang|ja|梨}} (''nashi'', ''ri'', ''rin'': the [[tree]]) and the [[fruit]].]]
{{ja-kanjitab|なし|yomi=kun}} From {{inh|ja|ojp|sort=なし}}. Derivation unclear, with numerous theories. Two of the more common are given below. * May be originally a compound of {{compound|ja|sort=なし|中|tr1=na|pos1=hypothesized root of modern naka|t1=middle, center|白|tr2=shiro|t2=white}} in reference to the pale flesh of the fruit. : *{{IPAchar|/na ɕiro/}} → {{IPAchar|/naɕi/}} * Alternatively, may be originally a compound of {{compound|ja|sort=なし|中|tr1=na|pos1=hypothesized root of modern naka|t1=middle, center|酢|tr2=su|t2=sour, acidic}} in reference to the way the flavor of the fruit becomes more astringent closer to the core. : *{{IPAchar|/na su/}} → {{IPAchar|/naɕi/}}
